source_sentence: ◎佛說貧窮老公經
translation: Sutra of the Buddha's Teaching to the poor and elderly

source_sentence: 宋沙門慧簡譯
translation: Song Dynasty Translation by the ascetic Huijian

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在舍衛國祇樹給孤獨園，與千二百五十沙門俱，菩薩萬人。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī, accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty śramaṇas and ten thousand bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 爾時，天龍鬼神、無央數大眾共會，恭敬圍繞，聞佛說法無不歡喜。
translation: At the time, gods, dragons, ghosts, spirits, and an immeasurable number of people assembled together, respectfully surrounded by them, and they all rejoiced when they heard the Buddha teach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 時有一貧窮老公，年二百歲，眉生秀毛，耳出於頭，齒如齊貝，手過於膝，
translation: Then there was a poor old man, two hundred years old, with hair growing from his eyebrows and hair standing straight up at the top of his head. His teeth were like those of a seashell shell; his hands extended over his knees.

source_sentence: 貌而視之，似如有相；
translation: They looked as if they had the same features.

source_sentence: 而貧窮辛苦衣不蓋形，五體裸露腹恒飢虛，行步纔動示有氣息。
translation: The poor and wretched, wearing painful clothes that don't cover their bodies, are always hungry with their five bodies naked and belly exposed, and they only move as little as a step to show the existence of breath.

source_sentence: 聞佛在世心獨歡喜，晝夜發願由來十年今始得果，扶杖而來求欲見佛，
translation: Hearing that the Buddha was living in the world, his mind was alone delighted. Day and night he made a vow to see him. In the past ten years he had just attained enlightenment. Relying on [the holy] cane, he came seeking to see the Buddha.

source_sentence: 釋梵侍門勅不通之。
translation: The Śākyamuni and Brahmā attendants ordered him not to do so.

source_sentence: 老公因大喚曰：「我生世不幸，貧窮辛苦飢餓寒凍，求死不得活無所賴。
translation: The old man then called out in a loud voice, saying, “I am unfortunately born in this world. Being poor and wretched, suffering from hunger and hunger and cold and freezing, I beg to die but cannot live.

source_sentence: 我聞世尊仁慈普逮，萬物蒙賴莫不受恩，心獨歡喜晝夜發願，由來十年今始得果，
translation: I have heard that the World-honored One’s benevolence and kindness extend to all living beings, without exception. All sentient beings who rely on him do not receive any favours from me. My mind is alone joyful and day and night imbued with a vow of enlightenment:

source_sentence: 是以遠來，乞一特見，求離眾苦。
translation: That's why I came from afar to ask for a special view, seeking to be freed from all suffering.

source_sentence: 而卿斷我，既違我願，又乖聖意，豈宜爾乎？」
translation: You've cut off me, and since you disobey my wishes and don't follow the noble intention, isn't that appropriate?

source_sentence: 佛已知之，顧語阿難：「汝寧見耆年長壽有相老公，而罹罪未畢者乎？」
translation: Knowing this, the Buddha looked at Ānanda and said to him, Would you rather see a senior man of long life with characteristics who hasn't finished committing crimes?

source_sentence: 阿難長跪叉手白佛言：「安有福耆壽而有罹罪，罹罪之人豈得有相？
translation: Ānanda knelt down and saluted the Buddha with his palms joined together. He said to him: How can a person guilty of crimes commit an offense even if he has a long life span? How could such a person have any characteristics?

source_sentence: 生所未見，今在何許？」
translation: Where will it be allowed now that it's not seen in the past?

source_sentence: 佛言：「近在門外。
translation: The Buddha said, They're near outside the gate.

source_sentence: 釋梵斷之，可呼使前。」
translation: If Śākyamuni and Brahmā cut them off, they can be called messengers.

source_sentence: 於是老公匍匐肘進，見佛悲喜涕淚交流，為佛作禮，長跪叉手白佛言：「我生世不幸，
translation: The old man then prostrated himself at the elbow’s length. Seeing the Buddha, he was overcome with grief and tears of joy. He paid homage to the Buddha [by bowing his forehead in respect] and knelt down cross-legged.

source_sentence: 貧窮辛苦，飢餓寒凍，求死不得，活無所賴。
translation: The poor and wretched suffer from hunger, thirst, hunger, cold, and no food to sustain their livelihood. They are unable to escape death and have no one to rely on for support.

source_sentence: 我聞世尊仁慈普逮，萬物蒙賴莫不受恩，心獨歡喜，晝夜發心，願一奉顏。
translation: I have heard that the World-honored One’s benevolence and kindness extended to all living beings without exception. All things depend on him for their support, and no one receives any kindness from me. Being alone delighted, I yearn day and night and arouse my aspiration, wishing to pay homage to his countenance.

source_sentence: 由來十年今始得果，向在門外，久不得前。
translation: It had been ten years since then but now he had just achieved the fruit. He was outside the gate but could not go in front for a long time.

source_sentence: 計欲還去，氣力不堪，進退無路。
translation: They thought they wanted to go back, but their energy was unbearable and there was no way to advance or retreat.

source_sentence: 但恐命絕，穢污聖門，重增其罪。
translation: But I fear that my life will be cut off and that the defiled holy gates will increase their sins.

source_sentence: 不悟天尊，已哀矜之，得蒙前進，如此而死，無復恨矣！
translation: They did not realize that the heavenly honored one had been moved to pity them, and they were allowed to advance; so they died like this, no longer resenting it!

source_sentence: 唯欲速終畢罪，後世願得垂恩，賜其上慧。」
translation: They only want to quickly end their sins, and in later generations they'll be granted superior wisdom if they wish to receive kindness.

source_sentence: 佛言：「人之受生生死因緣，以多因緣致有罪根，今我為汝說其本源。
translation: The Buddha said, A person's causes and conditions for being subject to birth and birth have many causes and conditions that give rise to sinful roots, so now I'll explain their original source for you.

source_sentence: 卿前世時，生豪強大國明慧王家，時為太子憍貴非凡，上為父母所珍，
translation: In a previous life you were born into the family of King Minghui of a powerful kingdom in a great country. At that time you were noble and extraordinary among princes, being treasured by your parents.

source_sentence: 下為臣民所奉，用此恣意輕[夌*欠]於人。
translation: The following is what the ministers and people serve, so they use this kind of unrestraint to despise [thousand*owes] others.

source_sentence: 高目大視矜抗邈然，財產巨億皆是民物，百姓貧窮皆坐課歛，唯知聚積不知布施。
translation: The high-eyed great courtier was overwhelmed by anger and resentment, and all the millions of property he possessed belonged to the common people. All the poor and impoverished among the common people sat in classes but knew nothing about accumulation and did not know how to give alms.

source_sentence: 「時有貧寒沙門，名曰靜志，從遠國來故往詣卿，所求不多唯乏法衣耳。
translation: At the time, there was a poor and cold ascetic named Jingzhi, who came from a distant land to visit you because he didn't have much to ask for, except for the Dharma robe.

source_sentence: 而卿了不當接，遇之甚惡，既不乞衣又不與食，空坐著前，去復不聽。
translation: When you understand it, you won't be able to receive it, and you'll encounter a great misfortune. If you don't beg for clothing or give food, you'll sit in front of him in an empty seat and go away without listening.

source_sentence: 晝夜七日七夕水漿斷絕，小有氣息，命在轉燭，而卿見此方大歡喜，聚眾看之以為至樂。
translation: Day and night, for seven days and nights, the water and juice will be completely extinguished. There will be a faint of breath in the small part of your body. Your life is about to change from one candle to another. But when you see this place, you will be greatly delighted. All the people who have gathered here to see it will regard it as most blis

source_sentence: 邊有侍臣，而諫卿曰：『太子莫爾！
translation: An attendant minister by the side remonstrated with you, saying, 'That's not true, prince!'

source_sentence: 沙門慈恭道德內存，凍之不寒、餓之不飢，所以來乞，欲為福耳！
translation: The ascetic Maitreya maintains his morality within himself, so that he doesn't frozen it and doesn't starve it; therefore, he comes to ask for alms, wanting to be blessed!

source_sentence: 既不施與，安使窮逼？
translation: If you don't give it, how can you be forced to beg for it?

source_sentence: 幸發遣之，莫招其罪。』
translation: fortunately, I'll send them away, so don't invite their sins.'

source_sentence: 「太子答曰：『此是何人，詐稱道德，試小困之，纔不令死。
translation: The prince answered, 'Who is this person who fraudulently praises his morality and tries to corner him so little that he won't die?

source_sentence: 正爾放去，無所憂也。』
translation: Just let him go, and there's nothing to worry about.'

source_sentence: 即便遣去驅逐出國。
translation: They were immediately expelled and driven out of the country.

source_sentence: 「未出國界十餘里中，遭逢餓賊欲殺噉之。
translation: Before leaving the country, he was about ten miles away from the border and met a hungry thief who wanted to kill him.

source_sentence: 沙門因言曰：『我是貧凍沙門，羸瘦骨立，肉既腥臊不中噉也。
translation: The ascetic then said, 'I am a poor and frozen ascetic who stands with emaciated bones, and my flesh is so smelly and foul that it won't be eaten.

source_sentence: 空當見殺，而無所任。』
translation: Emptiness will see killing, but there's nothing to tolerate.'

source_sentence: 「餓賊曰：『我飢困累日，但食土耳。
translation: The hungry thief said, 'I've been starving for days, but I've only eaten dirt.

source_sentence: 卿雖小瘦，故是肉也，終不相放，但當就死。』
translation: Even though you're small and thin, it's because you're flesh; you won't let go of me; I'll just die.'

source_sentence: 如此前却紛紜良久。
translation: It's been like this for a long time before that there was such a dispute.

source_sentence: 「太子得知，便往救曰：『我已不能乞其衣食，寧當復使餓賊殺之耶？』
translation: Knowing this, the prince went to rescue him, saying, 'Now that I can't beg for food or clothing, how could I let a hungry thief kill him?'

source_sentence: 賊見太子，皆各叩頭首過謝罪，放沙門去。
translation: When the thieves saw the prince, they each bowed their heads and apologized for their sins and released the ascetic.

source_sentence: 「時沙門者，今彌勒菩薩是也；
translation: “The śramaṇa of that time was Maitreya Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 憍貴太子者，今卿是也。
translation: This is what you are now, prince of the arrogance.

source_sentence: 卿今受此貧窮之罪者，坐前慳貪也；
translation: Now that you have suffered the punishment of being poor, you are sitting in front of me with greed and avarice.

source_sentence: 所以得長壽者，活救沙門之命也。
translation: The reason they attain longevity is to save the life of the ascetics.

source_sentence: 罪福報應，如影隨形，如響應聲。」
translation: The karmic retribution of sin and merit is like shadow following form or sound following sound.

source_sentence: 老公白佛：「去事已爾，願畢於今，願得以垂殘之命，得作沙門，後生世世常侍佛邊。」
translation: The old man said to the Buddha, After you've done so, may your vows be fulfilled in the present, and may you be allowed to give up a cruel life so that you can become an ascetic and be born in the future at the side of the Buddha who always serves him.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！」
translation: Excellent!

source_sentence: 應時，老公鬚髮墮地，法衣自然著身體，氣力強健，耳目聰明，即得上慧入三昧門。
translation: At the time, the old man's hair fell to the ground, his Dharma robe naturally touched his body, his energy was strong, and his ears and eyes were sharp, so he attained superior wisdom and entered the samādhi gate.

source_sentence: 「汝昔為太子，　　不識仁義方，
translation: In the past, you were a prince who did not know benevolence and righteousness.

source_sentence: 憍貴自放恣，　　恃為大國王，
translation: They are arrogant and self-indulgent, Relying on themselves as kings of great countries.

source_sentence: 自謂無罪福，　　以此可保常。
translation: They say they have no faults or merits, but because of these they can maintain their permanence.

source_sentence: 豈悟生死對，　　於今受其殃？
translation: Doesn't he realize that birth and death are opposed, and now he's subject to their misfortune?

source_sentence: 從罪復蒙祐，　　得覩天中天，
translation: From sin, he'll again be blessed, and he'll attain the heaven of deceitfulness among gods.

source_sentence: 能脫既往罪，　　垂命入法門。
translation: Being able to free themselves from past sins, they'll be allowed to enter the Dharma teaching with their lives.

source_sentence: 永離慳貪心，　　長受智慧根，
translation: Being forever free of the mind of stinginess and greed, they’ll long experience the faculty of wisdom.

source_sentence: 世世侍佛邊，　　保壽萬劫存。」
translation: They'll serve the Buddha from generation to generation, and their longevity will be preserved for ten thousand eons.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以偈頌曰：於是，老公比丘聞經歡喜，為佛作禮。
translation: At that time the World-honored One uttered these verses: Then the householder bhikṣu, having heard this discourse, was delighted and offered his respects to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊顧語阿難：「若有誦斯經者，當見賢劫千佛。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān looked around and said to Ānanda, If someone recites this sūtra, they'll see a thousand buddhas of the good eon.

source_sentence: 行斯經者，令後世宣傳，當從彌勒佛受決。
translation: Those who practice this sūtra will cause later generations to proclaim it, and they'll receive a ruling from Maitreya Buddha.

source_sentence: 如來廣長舌，所語無有異。」
translation: The Tathāgata's tongue is broad and long, and there's no difference between what he says.

source_sentence: 一切大眾聞佛說已，歡喜受持為佛作禮。
translation: After hearing what the Buddha taught, all the people in the assembly joyfully accepted it and bowed to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛說貧窮老公經
translation: Foshuo fangfu zhihuo jing
